summary: The Safer Neighborhoods Gun Buyback Act of 2025 authorizes the Director of the Bureau of Justice Assistance to provide grants to states, local governments, and gun dealers for gun buyback programs. The bill outlines the application process, grant terms, and permissible uses of funds, including requirements for smart prepaid cards, gun disposal, and administrative costs. Title II adds a criminal provision enacting penalties for the use of smart prepaid cards for acquiring or transferring firearms or ammunition. The bill provides $360,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2025-2027 to carry out this. This act aims to remove guns from the community.
